Courses.Name: ONEHEALT 3300A - FOUNDATIONS IN ONE HEALTH
Description: The history, core concepts and foundational approaches fundamental to this multi-sectoral and collaborative discipline are presented in lectures and in-depth case studies of the three pillars of One Health (human health, animal health and environmental health).

Notes: BLENDED COURSE. 1.5 HOURS ASYNCHRONOUS AND 1.5 HOURS IN-PERSON LECTURE.  PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Biology 1001A or Biology 1201A; Biology 1002B or Biology 1202B; either Biology 2244A/B or Statistical Sciences 2244A/B; and registration in third or fourth year of a BMSc or BSc degree.

Courses.Name: ONEHEALT 3600B - ONE HEALTH IN ACTION
Description: Key research designs and methodologic approaches fundamental to the multi-sectoral and collaborative discipline of One Health are presented in both lectures and in-depth case studies. Topics include study design and methods, data surveillance systems, engaging stakeholders, and implementing the One Health approach into action and policy change.

Notes: PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One Health 3300A/B with a minimum mark of 70%.
PRIORITY INFORMATION IS ON BMSc WEBSITE:  http://www.schulich.uwo.ca/bmsc/academic_resources/courses/access_to_courses.html. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): One Health 3300A/B with a minimum mark of 70%.

Courses.Name: ONEHEALT 4100G - ANIMAL/HUMAN HEALTH& COMP PATH
Description: The One Health concept acknowledges the global interdependence of people, animals, and the environment. This course focuses on the animal component of One Health. Areas of exploration will include wildlife, livestock, and companion animals, in addition to the use of animals in research, and comparative human and animal pathology.

Notes: CROSS-LISTED WITH MEDSCIEN 4100G. WAIT LIST OPTION AVAILABLE.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Enrolment in Year 4 of one of the following: an Honours Specialization in One Health, a BMSc degree, or an Honours BSc degree.

Courses.Name: ONEHEALT 4980E - SEMINAR & RESEARCH PROJECT
Description: Includes: i) theory and practice of research techniques and appropriate use of experimental models, ii) an independent research project supervised by faculty, iii) oral and written communication skills, including the preparation of a research proposal and final written research project report.
Extra Information: 10-15 laboratory/research hours per week plus 3 seminar hours per week.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 HONORS SPECIALIZATION IN ONE HEALTH.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Pathology 3500 with a mark of at least 70% or the former Pathology 3240A and the former Pathology 3245B with marks of at least 70% in each; and registration in Year 4 of the Honours Specialization in One Health.
